question: Recently, Scientists of the Botanical Survey of India (BSI) have found a new species of Zingiber which possesses ethno-medicinal uses. The pseudo stem of the new species is predominantly red in colour and the tuberous roots are used to treat abdominal pain and anti-helminthic troubles. In which part of India it has been discovered?
explanation: Recently, Scientists of the Botanical Survey of India (BSI) have found a new species of Zingiber from the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The new species indeed possesses ethno-medicinal uses. The fresh juice from the fleshy tuberous roots is used to treat abdominal pain and anti-helminthic troubles by Nicobarese and certain other tribal communities.
